title: Calories in 1 Tsp Olive Oil
meta_description: Discover calories in 1 tsp olive oil, plus full nutrition breakdown including fat content, and tips for healthy uses in cooking.
assumptions: Extra virgin olive oil; 1 tsp = 5 ml; pure oil, no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by olive variety, processing (extra virgin vs refined), and brand. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 1 tsp olive oil provides ~40 kcal, all from healthy monounsaturated fats.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with product packaging.

tweaks.label: Use refined olive oil instead of extra virgin

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 tsp olive oil?
Is olive oil high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, 1 tsp has 4.5 g fat, mostly monounsaturated (heart-healthy).

faqs.q: Does olive oil have carbs or protein?
faqs.a: Noâ€”0 g carbs, 0 g protein; it's pure fat.

faqs.q: What's the difference in calories between extra virgin and regular olive oil?
faqs.a: Extra virgin is ~40 kcal/tsp; refined may be slightly lower at ~35 kcal/tsp due to processing.

faqs.q: How many tsp of olive oil equal 1 tbsp?
faqs.a: Three tsp make 1 tbsp, so ~120 kcal total.
